verses.kjv: In the first year of Darius the son of Ahasuerus, of the seed of the Medes, which was made king over the realm of the Chaldeans;
verses.ct: During the 1st year of Darius son of Ahasuerus — a descendant of the Medes who had been appointed king over the Babylonian empire —

verses.kjv: In the first year of his reign I Daniel understood by books the number of the years, whereof the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah the prophet, that he would accomplish seventy years in the desolations of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: in the 1st year of his rule, I, Daniel, was studying the scriptures and realized from the number of years that the LORD had revealed to the prophet Jeremiah that Jerusalem's devastation would last 70 years.

verses.kjv: And I set my face unto the Lord God, to seek by prayer and supplications, with fasting, and sackcloth, and ashes:
verses.ct: So I turned to the Lord God, seeking him through prayer and pleas for mercy, along with fasting, sackcloth, and ashes.

verses.kjv: And I prayed unto the LORD my God, and made my confession, and said, O Lord, the great and dreadful God, keeping the covenant and mercy to them that love him, and to them that keep his commandments;
verses.ct: I prayed to the LORD my God and made this confession: 'Lord, you are the great and awesome God who keeps his covenant and shows mercy to those who love you and follow your commands.

verses.kjv: We have sinned, and have committed iniquity, and have done wickedly, and have rebelled, even by departing from thy precepts and from thy judgments:
verses.ct: We have sinned, done wrong, acted wickedly, and rebelled by turning away from your rules and your laws.

verses.kjv: Neither have we hearkened unto thy servants the prophets, which spake in thy name to our kings, our princes, and our fathers, and to all the people of the land.
verses.ct: We have not listened to your servants the prophets, who spoke in your name to our kings, our leaders, our ancestors, and to all the people of the land.

verses.kjv: O LORD, righteousness belongeth unto thee, but unto us confusion of faces, as at this day; to the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and unto all Israel, that are near, and that are far off, through all the countries whither thou hast driven them, because of their trespass that they have trespassed against thee.
verses.ct: LORD, righteousness belongs to you, but we are covered in shame today — the people of Judah, the residents of Jerusalem, and all of Israel, both near and far, in every country where you have scattered them because of the unfaithfulness they committed against you.

verses.kjv: O Lord, to us belongeth confusion of face, to our kings, to our princes, and to our fathers, because we have sinned against thee.
verses.ct: Lord, shame belongs to us — to our kings, our leaders, and our ancestors — because we have sinned against you.

verses.kjv: To the Lord our God belong mercies and forgivenesses, though we have rebelled against him;
verses.ct: Mercy and forgiveness belong to the Lord our God, even though we have rebelled against him.

verses.kjv: Neither have we obeyed the voice of the LORD our God, to walk in his laws, which he set before us by his servants the prophets.
verses.ct: We have not obeyed the LORD our God or followed his laws that he gave us through his servants the prophets.

verses.kjv: Yea, all Israel have transgressed thy law, even by departing, that they might not obey thy voice; therefore the curse is poured upon us, and the oath that is written in the law of Moses the servant of God, because we have sinned against him.
verses.ct: All of Israel has violated your law by turning away and refusing to obey you. That is why the curse and the sworn judgment written in the law of Moses, the servant of God, have been poured out on us, because we have sinned against him.

verses.kjv: And he hath confirmed his words, which he spake against us, and against our judges that judged us, by bringing upon us a great evil: for under the whole heaven hath not been done as hath been done upon Jerusalem.
verses.ct: He has carried out the warnings he spoke against us and against our rulers who governed us, by bringing on us a disaster so terrible that nothing like what happened to Jerusalem has ever occurred anywhere under all of heaven.

verses.kjv: As it is written in the law of Moses, all this evil is come upon us: yet made we not our prayer before the LORD our God, that we might turn from our iniquities, and understand thy truth.
verses.ct: Just as it is written in the law of Moses, all this disaster came upon us. Yet we still did not seek the LORD our God by turning from our sins and paying attention to your truth.

verses.kjv: Therefore hath the LORD watched upon the evil, and brought it upon us: for the LORD our God is righteous in all his works which he doeth: for we obeyed not his voice.
verses.ct: So the LORD kept this disaster ready and brought it on us, because the LORD our God is righteous in everything he does, and we refused to obey him.

verses.kjv: And now, O Lord our God, that hast brought thy people forth out of the land of Egypt with a mighty hand, and hast gotten thee renown, as at this day; we have sinned, we have done wickedly.
verses.ct: Now, Lord our God, you brought your people out of Egypt with your mighty power and made a name for yourself that endures to this day. We have sinned; we have acted wickedly.

verses.kjv: O LORD, according to all thy righteousness, I beseech thee, let thine anger and thy fury be turned away from thy city Jerusalem, thy holy mountain: because for our sins, and for the iniquities of our fathers, Jerusalem and thy people are become a reproach to all that are about us.
verses.ct: LORD, in keeping with all your righteous acts, I beg you — let your anger and your fury turn away from Jerusalem, your city, your holy mountain. Because of our sins and the wrongdoing of our ancestors, Jerusalem and your people have become an object of mockery to everyone around us.

verses.kjv: Now therefore, O our God, hear the prayer of thy servant, and his supplications, and cause thy face to shine upon thy sanctuary that is desolate, for the Lord’s sake.
verses.ct: So now, our God, hear the prayer and pleas of your servant. For your own sake, Lord, look with favor on your sanctuary that lies in ruins.

verses.kjv: O my God, incline thine ear, and hear; open thine eyes, and behold our desolations, and the city which is called by thy name: for we do not present our supplications before thee for our righteousnesses, but for thy great mercies.
verses.ct: My God, listen closely and hear. Open your eyes and see our devastation and the city that bears your name. We are not bringing our pleas to you because of our own righteousness, but because of your great mercy.

verses.kjv: O Lord, hear; O Lord, forgive; O Lord, hearken and do; defer not, for thine own sake, O my God: for thy city and thy people are called by thy name.
verses.ct: Lord, hear us! Lord, forgive us! Lord, listen and act! Don't delay — for your own sake, my God — because your city and your people bear your name.'

verses.kjv: And whiles I was speaking, and praying, and confessing my sin and the sin of my people Israel, and presenting my supplication before the LORD my God for the holy mountain of my God;
verses.ct: While I was still speaking, praying, confessing my sin and the sin of my people Israel, and bringing my plea to the LORD my God on behalf of his holy mountain —

verses.kjv: Yea, whiles I was speaking in prayer, even the man Gabriel, whom I had seen in the vision at the beginning, being caused to fly swiftly, touched me about the time of the evening oblation.
verses.ct: while I was still praying, the man Gabriel, whom I had seen in the earlier vision, came to me in swift flight and reached me around the time of the evening sacrifice.

verses.kjv: And he informed me, and talked with me, and said, O Daniel, I am now come forth to give thee skill and understanding.
verses.ct: He explained things to me and said, 'Daniel, I have come now to give you insight and understanding.

verses.kjv: At the beginning of thy supplications the commandment came forth, and I am come to shew thee; for thou art greatly beloved: therefore understand the matter, and consider the vision.
verses.ct: When you first began your pleas, a command was issued, and I have come to tell you, because you are deeply treasured. So pay close attention to the message and understand the vision.

verses.kjv: Seventy weeks are determined upon thy people and upon thy holy city, to finish the transgression, and to make an end of sins, and to make reconciliation for iniquity, and to bring in everlasting righteousness, and to seal up the vision and prophecy, and to anoint the most Holy.
verses.ct: 70 weeks have been decreed for your people and your holy city to put an end to rebellion, to bring sin to a close, to make atonement for wrongdoing, to establish everlasting righteousness, to seal up vision and prophecy, and to anoint the most holy place.

verses.kjv: Know therefore and understand, that from the going forth of the commandment to restore and to build Jerusalem unto the Messiah the Prince shall be seven weeks, and threescore and two weeks: the street shall be built again, and the wall, even in troublous times.
verses.ct: So know this and understand: from the time the decree goes out to restore and rebuild Jerusalem until the Messiah, the Prince, there will be 7 weeks and 62 weeks. It will be rebuilt with streets and a trench, but during difficult times.

verses.kjv: And after threescore and two weeks shall Messiah be cut off, but not for himself: and the people of the prince that shall come shall destroy the city and the sanctuary; and the end thereof shall be with a flood, and unto the end of the war desolations are determined.
verses.ct: After the 62 weeks, the Messiah will be killed, but not for himself. Then the people of a coming ruler will destroy the city and the sanctuary. Its end will come like a flood, and war and devastation are decreed until the very end.

verses.kjv: And he shall confirm the covenant with many for one week: and in the midst of the week he shall cause the sacrifice and the oblation to cease, and for the overspreading of abominations he shall make it desolate, even until the consummation, and that determined shall be poured upon the desolate.
verses.ct: He will enforce a covenant with many for 1 week, and in the middle of that week he will put a stop to sacrifice and offering. On the wing of abominations will come one who makes things desolate, until the decreed destruction is poured out on the one who causes desolation.'
